Posts.Title: Body Image - Lumpectomy

Posts.Content: Hi Everybody, I have just come across this thread and wanted to say that I finished five years of tamoxifen last September last year with very few side effects. I did experience the hot flushes at the beginning, but they lessened as time went on. There is another brand of tamoxifen your doctor can prescribe which apparently can lessen the sweats. Another method my friend was advised by her doctor was to half the tablet and take one half in the morning and the other at night. Kaz, my doctor advised that tamoxifen has it's optimum effect within two to three years, so I wouldn't worry about that. Advice is changing all the time. My GP advised that at one time everyone was kept on tamoxifen for 10 years then it was realised that that was bringing it's own prroblems so it was reduced to five and now has been realised that like I say the best effects are felt within the two to three year period. Tamoxifen can also increase your risk of endometrial (the lining of the womb) cancer so the less time it is taken the better. I hope this has been of some small help to all of you. Best wishes, Christine xx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen It Sounds Awful Is it Really That Bad?

Posts.Content: I meant to mention also that I have heard of a chilled pillow (A chillow) which is made specifically to help with the hot flushes. It is activated by filling with water and is much like the memory foam pillows. Once it is activated it is supposed to help keep you cool in bed. You can order them online and they cost around 25 pounds. I think there is also a whole body available. Worth looking into I suppose. Christine xx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen It Sounds Awful Is it Really That Bad?

Posts.Content: Hi Tessa, thought I would share my experience with you. I didn't have the same drugs as you, but the chemo I had made my hair fall out. I tried the cold cap. There are two types. One of them is hooked up to a machine which cools the scalp and the other (which is the one I was given) was taken straight from the freezer. When this was placed on my head it was horrendous as it was a block of pure ice surrounding my scalp. The headache I experienced was unbelievable and I also panicked, not only because of the pain, but because I felt claustrophobic as the cap is quite tight. I shouted at the nursing staff to remove it, but they convinced me to continue with it. They changed the cap at least another twice. I decided that it was not worth it to continue with the cap. My hair fell out a few days later anyway. I am not telling you this to frighten you, as I know a lot of other people have had different experiences with this. I did not find losing my hair a major problem as I knew it would grow back anyway, and is now down my back as it was before all this. I know that hair loss is a big thing to a lot of women, so I would never tell anybody not to try this. I just wanted to tell you how it was for me. Let me know what you decide and how things go for you. Christine xx
